ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English, derived from Old English ealne weg (ealne, accusative masculine singular of eal 'all' + weg 'way'), literally 'all the way.'

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adverb: modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb, expressing manner, place, time, or degree.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: At all times; on every occasion; continually.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He always wakes up before sunrise.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adverb: modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb, expressing manner, place, time, or degree.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In any case; nevertheless; used to express a fixed habit or characteristic behavior.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 无论如何；毕竟；强调既定事实或习惯。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: If you miss the train, you can always take the next bus.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 如果你错过了火车，你总可以搭下一班巴士。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adverb: modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb, expressing manner, place, time, or degree.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Continuously or repeatedly, often used in a slightly irritating or complaining tone about a constant action.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 老是；总是（带有不满或抱怨的语气）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: My neighbors are always having loud parties late at night.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我的邻居老是深更半夜开吵闹的派对。

REGISTER: Ubiquitous in all forms of communication.
